DOC.brief_summary: The ActionHealthNYC program year-long demonstration program improve access high quality health care NYC resident immigrant qualify public insurance incomes 200 % Federal Poverty Level ( FPL ) . The purpose study determine whether improved access care coordination service provide ActionHealth NYC program allow participant easy access healthcare ( particularly primary care preventive service ) non-participants .
DOC.detailed_description: The ActionHealthNYC program year-long demonstration program improve access high quality health care NYC resident immigrant qualify public insurance incomes 200 % Federal Poverty Level ( FPL ) . Our goal pilot program conducting research study understand follow question : - For client participate ActionHealthNYC program , report easy access health care ? - What differences health care utilization participant ActionHealthNYC program program ? - Do participant ActionHealthNYC program report few barrier need care compare program ? - Are participant ActionHealthNYC program likely receive preventive service accord United States Preventive Services Task Force ( USPTF ) recommend service qualify condition medical home ? - How likelihood receive new diagnosis compare ActionHealthNYC member group study group ? - How emergency department hospital use compare ActionHealthNYC member group study group ? We conduct randomize control trial ( RCT ) enrol 2,400 people meet eligibility criterion randomize half ActionHealth NYC program . We employ mixed method approach address difference participant randomize receive enhance service ActionHealthNYC ( AHNYC ) receive usual care , utilize survey , secondary data analysis , key informant interview participant focus group .
DOC.criteria: New York City resident uninsured , 19 old Not currently eligible Medicaid , Essential Plan , Not currently eligible private insurance via federal insurance marketplace subsidy due immigration status . Not New York City resident Currently eligible Medicaid , Essential Plan private insurance state exchange federal subsidy Income 200 % federal poverty level ( FPL ) Enrollees require NYC Municipal identification card ( IDNYC ) . If card , however , obtain come back enrollment .
